duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide infrastructure and O365 application support, including level three support for questions and problems related to O365 applications, service integration, and related hardware and software.
Interface with various technical teams to implement new technologies and support existing technologies, including Networking, Windows, Storage, and Information Security.
Architect and manage large scale and technically complex projects and upgrades, including Office 365 tenant management.

Execute projects and resolve complex problems in varying systems, including Enterprise level archiving, Exchange/Exchange Online, Active Directory, MS TEAMS, SharePoint Online, Conditional Access, and InTune.
Demonstrate strong team leading skills, superior work ethic, and ability to manage projects with little supervision.
Documentation and communication skills, providing recommendations on changes and design enhancements to improve the environment, services, processes, and security.
Participate in 24-hour on-call rotation and other duties as assigned.
Build relationships with team members and customers, and enhance intrateam collaboration. Provide superior customer support and ensure new technology initiatives are stable and readily maintained.
Provide in-depth diagnosis by gathering, organizing, and analyzing data for research and problem solving.

skills.skill: Microsoft Active Directory Design and Support
Active Directory, Shared Mailbox, and Resource Mailbox Management
DNS and Related Entries (SPF, DKIM, Dmarc, Mx records)
Server Virtualization Technology Deployment and Management

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and experience. MCSE certification required.
